com.marklogic.semantics.rdf4j

Class MarkLogicRepository

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.rdf4j.repository.base.AbstractRepository
      • com.marklogic.semantics.rdf4j.MarkLogicRepository
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MarkLogicClientDependent, org.eclipse.rdf4j.repository.Repository

    public class MarkLogicRepository
extends org.eclipse.rdf4j.repository.base.AbstractRepository
implements org.eclipse.rdf4j.repository.Repository, MarkLogicClientDependent
    RDF4J repository representing a MarkLogic triple store, exposing MarkLogic-specific features; SPARQL and Graph queries in all SPARQL forms, rulesets for inferencing, efficient size queries, combination queries, base uri, and permissions.

      • MarkLogicRepository

        public MarkLogicRepository(java.lang.String host,
                           int port,
                           java.lang.String user,
                           java.lang.String password,
                           java.lang.String auth)
        Constructor initialized with connection vars to MarkLogic server.
        Parameters:
        host - the host with the REST server
        port - the port for the REST server
        user - the user with read, write, or administrative privileges
        password - the password for the user
        auth - the type of authentication applied to the request

      • isWritable

        public boolean isWritable()
                   throws org.eclipse.rdf4j.repository.RepositoryException
        MarkLogic, with the correct permissions is always writable. Implemented to honor Repository interface.
        Specified by:

        Throws:

      • getConnection

        public MarkLogicRepositoryConnection getConnection()
                                            throws org.eclipse.rdf4j.repository.RepositoryException
        Returns a MarkLogicConnection object which is the entry point to performing all queries. It is best practice to reuse a single connection to a single MarkLogic database to take advantage of connection pooling capabilities built into java api client (which is a dependency within marklogic-rdf4j).
        Specified by:
        getConnection in interface org.eclipse.rdf4j.repository.Repository
        Returns:
        MarkLogicRepositoryConnection
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.rdf4j.repository.RepositoryException

        Parameters:
